actions.text: On agreeing to the Miller-Meeks amendment (A003) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 183 - 244 (Roll no. 107).
The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A003) pursuant to the rule.
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A003) offered by Mrs. Miller-Meeks.
Amendment failed by House: On agreeing to the Miller-Meeks amendment (A003) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 183 - 244 (Roll no. 107).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Miller-Meeks amendment (A003) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 183 - 244 (Roll no. 107).

description: An amendment numbered 4 printed in Part B of House Report 117-15 to revise the bill to provide a safe harbor for employers who conduct self-audits to identify and rectify potentially unlawful pay disparities and allows for reasonable employer defenses against trial lawyer abuses.
purpose: Amendment sought to provide a safe harbor for employers who conduct self-audits to identify and rectify potentially unlawful pay disparities and allow for reasonable employer defenses against trial lawyer abuses.
